title: Alternate wetting and drying (AWD)--using less water to grow rice

tasks.task: Implement Alternate Wetting and Drying (AWD) technique for water-saving in irrigated rice fields.
subtasks: Observe water depth in rice field using a field water tube.
Reflood field when water level drops 15 cm below soil surface.
Keep water depth at 5 cm during critical growth stages (e.g., 1-2 weeks post-transplanting, before peak flowering).
Manage weeds by postponing AWD until weeds are suppressed.
Apply nitrogen fertilizer on dry soil before irrigation.
Use local fertilizer recommendations for flooded rice.
Check water level in field water tube weekly.
Adjust AWD threshold depth based on farmer confidence and soil type.
Construct a simple field water tube from plastic pipe or bamboo.
Drill holes (0.5 cm diameter, 2 cm apart) in bottom 20 cm of tube.
Bury tube vertically 20 cm above soil surface, avoiding hard pan.

tasks.task: Foster community-level adoption of AWD for rice irrigation.
subtasks: Promote AWD benefits and water savings through community engagement.
Address demographic and socio-economic factors in AWD adoption.
Encourage farmer-designed experiments and adjustments to AWD practices.
